newsitem.title: USA: Boeing, McDonnell Douglas file merger application.
newsitem.headline: Boeing, McDonnell Douglas file merger application.

text.p: Boeing Co and McDonnell Douglas Corp formally filed with the government for their proposed merger, a Boeing spokesman said.
The spokesman said the application was filed late Wednesday, more than a month after the announcement Dec. 15 that the two companies would seek to merge.
Attorney General Janet Reno has said the Federal Trade Commission will review the application.
Theoretically, the government has a short time to review the merger, but Boeing President and CEO Phil Condit said he expected the process to take six months. Analysts agreed.
